GOD.content: as soon as I enter into relation w/ absolute other, my singularity enters into relation w/ his on level of obligation & duty, but this binds me to sacrifice, and there are infinite others
GOD.linkedContent: as soon as I enter into relation w/ absolute other, my singularity enters into relation w/ his on level of obligation & duty, but this binds me to sacrifice, and there are infinite others

GOD.content: betrayal as leaving out the other others
Bartleby and Abraham speak in tongues: language of the Other
GOD.linkedContent: Bartleby and Abraham speak in tongues: language of the Other

GT.content: beggars (in their exteriority) can represent absolute demand of the Other, inextinguishable appeal, unquenchable thirst for the gift
GT.linkedContent: beggars (in their exteriority) can represent absolute demand of the Other, inextinguishable appeal, unquenchable thirst for the gift

MONL.content: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself
MONL.linkedContent: necessity of other in language, always re-marked: one more first time, historical and singular, determines & phenomenalizes itself by bringing it back to itself

MONL.content: there are 2 others: 1) language of the other as promised sentence 2) language of other as that of master or colonist; both have unsettling resemblances kept secret, held in reserve
MONL.linkedContent: there are 2 others: 1) language of the other as promised sentence 2) language of other as that of master or colonist; both have unsettling resemblances kept secret, held in reserve

FK.content: link to the other precedes all community

SPOM.content: beyond morality, beyond juridicism, beyond right, w/out calculable insurance against evil > only way to do justice to other as other
SPOM.linkedContent: beyond morality, beyond juridicism, beyond right, w/out calculable insurance against evil > only way to do justice to other as other

HERP.content: polemos forms the unity, “in the conflict with the other the world comes about (In der Aus-einandersetzung wird Welt)”
HERP.linkedContent: polemos forms the unity, “in the conflict with the other the world comes about (In der Aus-einandersetzung wird Welt)”

MPM.content: we cannot save the dead from death or include dead in narcissistic fantasy; the bereaved memory: first coming of the Other
MPM.linkedContent: we cannot save the dead from death or include dead in narcissistic fantasy; the bereaved memory: first coming of the Other

MPM.content: possibility of death of the other in-forms any relation to other & finitude of memory
MPM.linkedContent: possibility of death of the other in-forms any relation to other & finitude of memory

MPM.content: failure to interiorize the other succeeds in respecting the other as other
MPM.linkedContent: failure to interiorize the other succeeds in respecting the other as other

MPM.content: no choice but to let other speak, cannot make other speak w/out other having already spoken—in trace, part greater/less than whole
MPM.linkedContent: no choice but to let other speak, cannot make other speak w/out other having already spoken—in trace, part greater/less than whole

MPM.content: other as other: “non-totalizable trace inadequate to itself and the same”
MPM.linkedContent: other as other: “non-totalizable trace inadequate to itself and the same”

MSUBJ.content: everything is singular each time and each time analogical: a figuration of the other
MSUBJ.linkedContent: everything is singular each time and each time analogical: a figuration of the other

A.content: decision concerns choice btwn relation w/ a wholly non-opposable other (an other that’s not its other) and an other who is its other (can be opposed in a couple) > the former relation is that of aporia, not a crossing of border but a double concept of the border
A.linkedContent: decision concerns choice btwn relation w/ a wholly non-opposable other (an other that’s not its other) and an other who is its other (can be opposed in a couple) > the former relation is that of aporia, not a crossing of border but a double concept of the border

A.content: if death is possibility of impossible for Heidegger, Dasein never has relation to death as such, only to perishing, to death of the other (who is not the other), death of other in “me” only death named in syntagm “my death” > thus s’attendre, s’attendre l’un l’autre, s’attendre soi-même à la mort
A.linkedContent: if death is possibility of impossible for Heidegger, Dasein never has relation to death as such, only to perishing, to death of the other (who is not the other), death of other in “me” only death named in syntagm “my death” > thus s’attendre, s’attendre l’un l’autre, s’attendre soi-même à la mort

SEC.content: iter (from itara, other, in Sanskrit) > everything that links otherness to repetition
SEC.linkedContent: iter (from itara, other, in Sanskrit) > everything that links otherness to repetition

PP.content: philosophy determines itself and its other at the same time
PP.linkedContent: philosophy determines itself and its other at the same time

VM.content: via Levinas, Eleatic Stranger, disciple of Parmenides, avait dû lui donner raison pour avoir raison de lui: pliant le non-être à être [other only in contrast to Being]
VM.linkedContent: via Levinas, Eleatic Stranger, disciple of Parmenides, avait dû lui donner raison pour avoir raison de lui: pliant le non-être à être [other only in contrast to Being]

VM.content: acc. Levinas, no time, no history, w/out absolute alterity of each instant
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, no time, no history, w/out absolute alterity of each instant

VM.content: Levinas’ eschatology as encounter (rencontre) w/ unforeseeably other seems infinitely hopeless, awaiting nothing; Levinas even calls it renunciation [madness?]
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ eschatology as encounter (rencontre) w/ unforeseeably other seems infinitely hopeless, awaiting nothing; Levinas even calls it renunciation [madness?]

VM.content: for Levinas, encounter w/ other, separation, rupture (brisure) of “formal logic”
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, encounter w/ other, separation, rupture (brisure) of “formal logic”

VM.content: for Levinas, neutral thought of Being neutralizes Other as a being
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, neutral thought of Being neutralizes Other as a being

VM.content: for Levinas, can only, must only, speak to Other; must use the vocative (never accusative which would objectify Other), bursting forth, very raising up of speech
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, can only, must only, speak to Other; must use the vocative (never accusative which would objectify Other), bursting forth, very raising up of speech

VM.content: [Derrida on philology of other > autrui (substantive that’s not a noun), autre, heteron, alter-huic > what does autre mean before Greek heteron? before Judeo-Christian autrui?]
VM.linkedContent: [Derrida on philology of other > autrui (substantive that’s not a noun), autre, heteron, alter-huic > what does autre mean before Greek heteron? before Judeo-Christian autrui?]

VM.content: Other is disorder of our conceptuality, autrui is undeclinable [cf. S p. 88 Heidegger on decline (Untergang)]
VM.linkedContent: Other is disorder of our conceptuality, autrui is undeclinable [cf. S p. 88 Heidegger on decline (Untergang)]

VM.content: via Husserl, system of 2 alterities: alterity of body (perception) required for emergence of radical, transcendental alterity: cannot experience from Other’s perspective
VM.linkedContent: via Husserl, system of 2 alterities: alterity of body (perception) required for emergence of radical, transcendental alterity: cannot experience from Other’s perspective

VM.content: other cannot be absolutely exterior to the same w/out ceasing to be other, in which case though, it is no longer infinitely other [Kant’s 4<sup><small>th</small></sup> antinomy] [Parmenidean virtuosity]
VM.linkedContent: other cannot be absolutely exterior to the same w/out ceasing to be other, in which case though, it is no longer infinitely other [Kant’s 4th antinomy] [Parmenidean virtuosity]

VM.content: “other” is the name, the unthinkable unity of light and night > “phenomenon supposes original contamination by the sign”
VM.linkedContent: “other” is the name, the unthinkable unity of light and night > “phenomenon supposes original contamination by the sign”

VM.content: if other is called trace it can only be metaphorical, for it must be made to appear
VM.linkedContent: if other is called trace it can only be metaphorical, for it must be made to appear

VM.content: for Levinas, tragedy of ego, riveted to its own being > even in transcendence toward, venturing toward, the Other
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, tragedy of ego, riveted to its own being > even in transcendence toward, venturing toward, the Other

VM.content: Being conditions respect for the other, as what it is: other > w/out Being’s “laisser-être” (of ethical commandment, freedom) violence to such a degree it couldn’t appear or be named
VM.linkedContent: Being conditions respect for the other, as what it is: other > w/out Being’s “laisser-être” (of ethical commandment, freedom) violence to such a degree it couldn’t appear or be named

PAS.content: every revolution needs to take account of Blanchot’s forgetting, forgetting w/out forgetting, a forgetting beyond the protection of repression, a forgetting that describes the whole history of dissimulation > pas d’autre
PAS.linkedContent: every revolution needs to take account of Blanchot’s forgetting, forgetting w/out forgetting, a forgetting beyond the protection of repression, a forgetting that describes the whole history of dissimulation > pas d’autre

PAS.content: chance and necessity de la langue, la nécessité, la chance, marque encore la chance, the risk: que l’autre de la langue se passe dans le pas au-delà de la langue, not its other but the other sans elle (language)
PAS.linkedContent: chance and necessity de la langue, la nécessité, la chance, marque encore la chance, the risk: que l’autre de la langue se passe dans le pas au-delà de la langue, not its other but the other sans elle (language)

PAS.content: sans lets come back what is dissimulated as tout autre and can only be dissimulated
PAS.linkedContent: sans lets come back what is dissimulated as tout autre and can only be dissimulated

VP.content: indicative language (another name of the relation to death) is process of death at work in signs > as soon as other appears, it can no longer be erased; so Husserl must suspend relation to other
VP.linkedContent: indicative language (another name of the relation to death) is process of death at work in signs > as soon as other appears, it can no longer be erased; so Husserl must suspend relation to other

T.content: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit
T.linkedContent: philosophy has always thought its other, that which limits it; does to think the other solely mean relever, to control the other? or does the limit/passage always reserve one more coup; to think the proper of the other, the other as such is to miss it, to miss the missing of the other [on manque (de) le manquer]: examine the relevance of the limit

PPHS.content: Hegel: idea is in full possession of itself while it is [its] other
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: idea is in full possession of itself while it is [its] other

F.content: via Abraham, in deciphering poem, “translator” has written one: poetic translation or psychoanalytic interpretation [re: “ghost”] > clears path for other w/out unilateral privilege
F.linkedContent: via Abraham, in deciphering poem, “translator” has written one: poetic translation or psychoanalytic interpretation [re: “ghost”] > clears path for other w/out unilateral privilege

F.content: other—atopique > means they can never tell you how they want to be eaten
F.linkedContent: other—atopique > means they can never tell you how they want to be eaten

FWT.content: instead of determinism of “subject,” of “freedom,” Derrida advocates resistance of singularity, event, site of other > exposed to what comes, never reduced to rules, calculation
FWT.linkedContent: instead of determinism of “subject,” of “freedom,” Derrida advocates resistance of singularity, event, site of other > exposed to what comes, never reduced to rules, calculation

ROP.content: paralysis gives movement w/ regard to its other [this is in reference to impossibility of psychoanalysis’ auto-interpretation] (in PAS, paralysis distinguished from logic of analysis)
ROP.linkedContent: paralysis gives movement w/ regard to its other [this is in reference to impossibility of psychoanalysis’ auto-interpretation] (in PAS, paralysis distinguished from logic of analysis)

ATIA.content: bottomless gaze of other [Levinas], the animal [?], seeing not just seen eyes of other; abyssal limit of the human, ends of man, bordercrossing where man announces himself, ultimate and first event of the end, unveiling, verdict; instant of extreme passion, je suis the apocalypse itself > when all this passes I can speak calmly of beasts of Apocalypse, visit them at the zoo
ATIA.linkedContent: bottomless gaze of other [Levinas], the animal [?], seeing not just seen eyes of other; abyssal limit of the human, ends of man, bordercrossing where man announces himself, ultimate and first event of the end, unveiling, verdict; instant of extreme passion, je suis the apocalypse itself > when all this passes I can speak calmly of beasts of Apocalypse, visit them at the zoo

ATIA.content: Levinas’ 3rd party, an other of the other, in contrast to Lacan’s “there is no Other of the Other” > but, for both of them, what about the animal-other?
ATIA.linkedContent: Levinas’ 3rd party, an other of the other, in contrast to Lacan’s “there is no Other of the Other” > but, for both of them, what about the animal-other?

FS.content: Hegel demonstrated that explication of a phenomenon by a force is tautology; yet, one must consider this w/in language’s inability to emerge from itself, not solely w/in thought of force
FS.linkedContent: Hegel demonstrated that explication of a phenomenon by a force is tautology; yet, one must consider this w/in language’s inability to emerge from itself, not solely w/in thought of force

FS.content: force is the other of language [by articulating it, becomes a phenomenon]
FS.linkedContent: force is the other of language [by articulating it, becomes a phenomenon]

DIF.content: differance not a process of propriation, neither “species” of genus Being nor Ereignis (nor ontological difference): neither appropriation (position), nor expropriation (negation)—it is other
DIF.linkedContent: differance not a process of propriation, neither “species” of genus Being nor Ereignis (nor ontological difference): neither appropriation (position), nor expropriation (negation)—it is other

REST.content: what is a pair in this case? a catastrophic question [?], the other is the catastrophe [?], the other is kept at a distance
REST.linkedContent: what is a pair in this case? a catastrophic question [?], the other is the catastrophe [?], the other is kept at a distance

REST.content: the other one [the other lowness], always the supplement of lowness (le bas) [re: political insults in Heidegger/Shapiro’s correspondence]
REST.linkedContent: the other one [the other lowness], always the supplement of lowness (le bas) [re: political insults in Heidegger/Shapiro’s correspondence]

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: figural is never one, it is the Other, and there is no unity or stability of the figural, imago has no fixity, no proper being
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: figural is never one, it is the Other, and there is no unity or stability of the figural, imago has no fixity, no proper being

PIO.content: other as the uninvented, in invention, must let other come, not make the other: deconstructive invention as opening, uncloseting, destabilizing foreclusionary structures
PIO.linkedContent: other as the uninvented, in invention, must let other come, not make the other: deconstructive invention as opening, uncloseting, destabilizing foreclusionary structures

PIO.content: beyond the possible invention, invention of the other that would come while miming/repeating economy of same
PIO.linkedContent: beyond the possible invention, invention of the other that would come while miming/repeating economy of same

PIO.content: to invent the other is impossible, thus it’s the only invention: the invention that invents us
PIO.linkedContent: to invent the other is impossible, thus it’s the only invention: the invention that invents us

PIO.content: the other is always another origin of the world, and we are to be invented > beyond being
PIO.linkedContent: the other is always another origin of the world, and we are to be invented > beyond being

PIO.content: sole concern of invention of the other (the coming of invention): allow adventure or event of tout autre to come > future-to-come
PIO.linkedContent: sole concern of invention of the other (the coming of invention): allow adventure or event of tout autre to come > future-to-come

PIO.content: power of closure ensured by economy of the same, not to be rejected, criticized, combatted > economic circle of invention reappropriates what it sets in motion, the differance of the other (which can’t be reduced to meaning, truth, existence)
PIO.linkedContent: power of closure ensured by economy of the same, not to be rejected, criticized, combatted > economic circle of invention reappropriates what it sets in motion, the differance of the other (which can’t be reduced to meaning, truth, existence)

PIO.content: the other is not the new, never inventible
PIO.linkedContent: the other is not the new, never inventible

PIO.content: “the call of the other is a call to come, and that happens only in multiple voices”
PIO.linkedContent: “the call of the other is a call to come, and that happens only in multiple voices”

PF.content: injunction “it is necessary” of future-to-come can receive indifferently names “event” and “other” > irreducible to calculation, program, project, subject, object, anticipation
PF.linkedContent: injunction “it is necessary” of future-to-come can receive indifferently names “event” and “other” > irreducible to calculation, program, project, subject, object, anticipation

PF.content: to take other in w/out lodging chez soi is one formula for the possibility of the impossible
PF.linkedContent: to take other in w/out lodging chez soi is one formula for the possibility of the impossible

PSSS.content: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other
PSSS.linkedContent: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other

HST.content: forgiveness, hospitality, gift, affix condition of impossibility to the other: gift as most unforgivable
HST.linkedContent: forgiveness, hospitality, gift, affix condition of impossibility to the other: gift as most unforgivable

TN.content: Merleau-Ponty’s “it is a non-coincidence I coincide w/ here” can only be upset by thinking cum otherwise, w/ Nancy: “the other turns out to be the other of the w/”
TN.linkedContent: Merleau-Ponty’s “it is a non-coincidence I coincide w/ here” can only be upset by thinking cum otherwise, w/ Nancy: “the other turns out to be the other of the w/”

TN.content: law of parting/sharing at heart of con-tact: “inoperative community”
TN.linkedContent: law of parting/sharing at heart of con-tact: “inoperative community”

ATM.content: there must be a series of Levinas’ même moment if writing of dislocation of the Same toward the Relation [to the Other] is to have a chance, a hold (prise)
ATM.linkedContent: there must be a series of Levinas’ même moment if writing of dislocation of the Same toward the Relation [to the Other] is to have a chance, a hold (prise)

ATM.content: the Relation to the Other is not a phenomenal monstration, and is not readable w/in the uncertainty of rigorous limits of a lexicon, language, semiotics, logic, etc.
ATM.linkedContent: the Relation to the Other is not a phenomenal monstration, and is not readable w/in the uncertainty of rigorous limits of a lexicon, language, semiotics, logic, etc.

AD.content: for Levinas, forgetting the other would attest to its absolute truth
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, forgetting the other would attest to its absolute truth

BSi.content: for Celan, letting the other speak what in the other is most other: let time speak
BSi.linkedContent: for Celan, letting the other speak what in the other is most other: let time speak

BSi.content: “after you”: my first address to other as other
BSi.linkedContent: “after you”: my first address to other as other

OG.content: Rousseau’s 2 ways (moyens) pour agir sur les sens de l’autre (to act on the senses of others): le mouvement et la voix
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s 2 ways (moyens) pour agir sur les sens de l’autre (to act on the senses of others): le mouvement et la voix

OG.content: movement is immediate by touch or mediated by gesture
OG.linkedContent: movement is immediate by touch or mediated by gesture

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] absolute fear as original encounter w/ other as other, 1st passion, la face d’erreur de la pitié
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] absolute fear as original encounter w/ other as other, 1st passion, la face d’erreur de la pitié

EU.content: philosophy finds itself inscribed w/in space it can’t order, opens to an other not even its other > in a tympanum as little Hegelian as possible
EU.linkedContent: philosophy finds itself inscribed w/in space it can’t order, opens to an other not even its other > in a tympanum as little Hegelian as possible
